Program¶

modules.Module_Test.csv_creator(writing_path_input, writing_input)¶

This function will create .csv files

Parameters

  • writing_path_input (string) – Path where the .csv file will be created

  • writing_input (TO BE DONE) – What info we want to add to the .csv file, normally a Matrix/Array 3D

modules.Module_Test.csv_mixer(path_input1, path_input2, writing_path_input)¶

Mixes two .csv files. Then, uses csv_creator() to generate a .csv with the mixed files.

Parameters

  • path_input1 (string) – Path to the first .csv to mix. It will take the first rows in the final mixed file.

  • path_input2 (string) – Path to the second .csv to mix. It will take rows adther the first .csv.

  • writing_path_input (string) – path to both .csv files

modules.Module_Test.folder_creator(options)¶

Creates a Folder in the current path

Paran options

Name of the folder

Returns

Folder in the current directory

modules.blaster.blast_blaster(query_path, dict_path, outfile_path, perc_identity)¶

This module calls for blastn in the BLASTR command line. See Command Line Application User Manual for more information.

Arguments used in blastn¶

Argument

Description

word_size
11 by default.
BLAST search starts with finding a perfect sequence match of length given by this parameter.
See world_size info for more information.
modules.blaster.blastn_dic(path_input)¶

Creation af a BLAST database of our whole genome. It uses the BLASTR command line, see BLAST Command Line Application User Manual for more information.

The generation of the properly database will be placed in the .fasta directory. It is recommended to use a dedicated folder to this genome.

Parameters

path_input (string) – path to where our file genome sequence .fasta is
